001// Copyright (c) Choreo contributors
002
003package choreo.auto;
004
005import edu.wpi.first.networktables.NetworkTable;
006import edu.wpi.first.networktables.NetworkTableInstance;
007import edu.wpi.first.networktables.StringArrayEntry;
008import edu.wpi.first.networktables.StringEntry;
009import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.DriverStation;
010import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.IterativeRobotBase;
011import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Command;
012import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Commands;
013import java.util.HashMap;
014import java.util.Map;
015import java.util.function.Function;
016
017/**
018 * An auto chooser that allows for the selection of auto routines at runtime.
019 *
020 * <p>This chooser takes a lazy loading approach to auto routines, only generating the auto routine
021 * when it is selected. This approach has the benefit of not loading all autos on startup, but also
022 * not loading the auto during auto start causing a delay.
023 *
024 * <p>Once the {@link AutoChooser} is made you can add auto routines to it using the {@link
025 * #addAutoRoutine(String, AutoRoutineGenerator)} method. Unlike {@code SendableChooser} this
026 * chooser has to be updated every cycle by calling the {@link #update()} method in your {@link
027 * IterativeRobotBase#robotPeriodic()}.
028 *
029 * <p>You can retrieve the auto routine {@link Command} that is currently selected by calling the
030 * {@link #getSelectedAutoRoutine()} method.
031 */
032public class AutoChooser {
033  /** A function that generates an auto routine {@link Command} from an {@link AutoFactory}. */
034  public static interface AutoRoutineGenerator extends Function<AutoFactory, Command> {
035    /** A generator that returns a command that does nothing */
036    static final AutoRoutineGenerator NONE = factory -> Commands.none().withName("Do Nothing Auto");
037  }
038
039  private static final String NONE_NAME = "Nothing";
040
041  private final HashMap<String, AutoRoutineGenerator> autoRoutines =
042      new HashMap<>(Map.of(NONE_NAME, AutoRoutineGenerator.NONE));
043
044  private final StringEntry selected, active;
045  private final StringArrayEntry options;
046
047  private final AutoFactory factory;
048
049  private String lastAutoRoutineName = NONE_NAME;
050  private Command lastAutoRoutine = AutoRoutineGenerator.NONE.apply(null);
051
052  /**
053   * Create a new auto chooser.
054   *
055   * @param factory The auto factory to use for auto routine generation.
056   * @param tableName The name of the network table to use for the chooser, passing in an empty
057   *     string will put this chooser at the root of the network tables.
058   */
059  public AutoChooser(AutoFactory factory, String tableName) {
060    this.factory = factory;
061
062    String path = NetworkTable.normalizeKey(tableName, true) + "/AutoChooser";
063    NetworkTable table = NetworkTableInstance.getDefault().getTable(path);
064
065    selected = table.getStringTopic("selected").getEntry(NONE_NAME);
066    table.getStringTopic(".type").publish().set("String Chooser");
067    table.getStringTopic("default").publish().set(NONE_NAME);
068    active = table.getStringTopic("active").getEntry(NONE_NAME);
069    options =
070        table.getStringArrayTopic("options").getEntry(autoRoutines.keySet().toArray(new String[0]));
071  }
072
073  /**
074   * Update the auto chooser.
075   *
076   * <p>This method should be called every cycle in the {@link IterativeRobotBase#robotPeriodic()}.
077   * It will check if the selected auto routine has changed and update the active auto routine.
078   */
079  public void update() {
080    if (DriverStation.isDisabled() || IterativeRobotBase.isSimulation()) {
081      String selectStr = selected.get();
082      if (selectStr.equals(lastAutoRoutineName)) return;
083      if (!autoRoutines.containsKey(selectStr)) {
084        selected.set(NONE_NAME);
085        selectStr = NONE_NAME;
086        DriverStation.reportError("Selected an auto that isn't an option", false);
087      }
088      lastAutoRoutineName = selectStr;
089      lastAutoRoutine = autoRoutines.get(lastAutoRoutineName).apply(this.factory);
090      active.set(lastAutoRoutineName);
091    }
092  }
093
094  /**
095   * Add an auto routine to the chooser.
096   *
097   * <p>An auto routine is a function that takes an AutoFactory and returns a Command. These
098   * functions can be static, a lambda or belong to a local variable.
099   *
100   * <p>A good paradigm is making an `AutoRoutines` class that has a reference to all your
101   * subsystems and has helper methods for auto commands inside it. Then you crate methods inside
102   * that class that take an `AutoFactory` and return a `Command`.
103   *
104   * @param name The name of the auto routine.
105   * @param generator The function that generates the auto routine.
106   */
107  public void addAutoRoutine(String name, AutoRoutineGenerator generator) {
108    autoRoutines.put(name, generator);
109    options.set(autoRoutines.keySet().toArray(new String[0]));
110  }
111
112  /**
113   * Choose an auto routine by name.
114   *
115   * @param choice The name of the auto routine to choose.
116   */
117  public void choose(String choice) {
118    selected.set(choice);
119    update();
120  }
121
122  /**
123   * Get the currently selected auto routine.
124   *
125   * @return The currently selected auto routine.
126   */
127  public Command getSelectedAutoRoutine() {
128    return lastAutoRoutine;
129  }
130}
